title: stage1 could not compile rustc-main (rust 1.15 buildroot)
body:
Trying to update the build environment to rust 1.15 on buildroot. 

We used to download the previous rust and use that to bootstrap the current version. We are trying to leverage the new rust scripts that download their own **stage0** and go from there but we've been getting into issue after issue. 

The latest issue is the following, not sure if its a pilot error or something else missing on the config. 

Any idea what's going on?

```
Building stage1 compiler artifacts (x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu -> x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu)
   Compiling rustc-main v0.0.0 (file:///xxx/src/rustc)
error: linking with `cc` failed: exit code: 1
  |
  = note: "cc" "-Wl,--as-needed" "-Wl,-z,noexecstack" "-m64" "-L" "/xxx/build/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage1/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib" "/xxx/build/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage1-rustc/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/release/rustdoc.0.o" "-o" "/xxx/build/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage1-rustc/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/release/rustdoc" "-Wl,--gc-sections" "-pie" "-Wl,-O1" "-nodefaultlibs" "-L" "/xxx/build/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage1-rustc/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/release/deps" "-L" ```
```

---

The configuration looks like:

```cmake
define HOST_RUST_BUILDROOT_CONFIGURE_CMDS
	(cd $(@D); $(HOST_CONFIGURE_OPTS) \
		$(HOST_RUST_BUILDROOT_CONF_ENV) \
		./configure \
		--target=$(GNU_TARGET_NAME) \
		--prefix="$(HOST_DIR)/usr" \
		--jemalloc-root="$(HOST_DIR)/usr/lib/libjemalloc_pic.a" \
		--disable-docs \
		--disable-manage-submodules \
		--sysconfdir="$(HOST_DIR)/etc" \
		--localstatedir="$(HOST_DIR)/var/lib" \
		--datadir="$(HOST_DIR)/usr/share" \
		--infodir="$(HOST_DIR)/usr/share/info" \
		$(HOST_RUST_BUILDROOT_CONF_OPTS) \
	)
endef
```
